arm_group.description: Patients treated with noninvasive ventilation for an episode of acute respiratory failure

brief_summary.textblock:
To assess risk of skin pressure lesions in patients treated with noninvasive mechanical
      ventilation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Noninvasive Positive Airway Pressure Ventilation and Risk of Facial Pressure Ulcers

detailed_description.textblock:
Noninvasive ventilation improves the outcome of patients with acute respiratory failure;
      however patient's discomfort may be responsible for up to a fifth of failures. Scant
      literature exists on NIV-related pressure ulcers and their determinants.

      Aim of the study is to seek for determinants, if any, associated with the development of
      pressure ulcers related to noninvasive ventilation.

      Study design: observational. Patients treated with NIV from December 2009 to December 2011
      will be analyzed. Main end-points: to seek for variables associated to the development of
      NIV-related pressure ulcers in patients with acute respiratory failure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  severe dyspnea at rest

          -  respiratory rate > 30 per minute

          -  PaO2/FiO2 < 200 (despite oxygen with Venturi with a FiO2 og 0.5)

          -  use of accessory respiratory muscles

          -  pH < 7.35 > 7.10

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  STEMI

          -  NSTEMI/Unstable angina

          -  Hemodynamic instability

          -  Need for immediate endotracheal intubation

          -  Inability to protect the airways

          -  Impaired sensorium

          -  Pulmonary embolism

          -  Gastrointestinal bleeding

          -  Hematological malignancy or neoplasms with ECOG performance status > 2

study_pop.textblock:
Patients admitted to our high dependency unit for an episode of acute respiratory failure
        and treated with noninvasive ventilation.

other_name: - Oro-nasal mask: Ultra Mirage NV, ResMed Australia
- Full-face mask: Performax, Respironics Inc USA
- Helmet: Castar R, StarMed - Mirandola Italy

facility.name: Medicina d'Urgenza - Terapia Subintensiva. Ospedale S. Giovanni Bosco

clinical_study.official_title: Noninvasive Positive Airway Pressure Ventilation and Risk of Facial Pressure Ulcers in Patients With Acute Respiratory Failure

primary_outcome.description:
Skin lesions were classified as follows:
reddening,
loss of skin integrity,
necrotic lesion.
primary_outcome.measure: Risk of skin pressure ulcers in patients treated with noninvasive ventilation for acute respiratory failure.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Risk of pressure ulcers within 72 hours from noninvasive ventilation beginning.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Characterization of skin lesions during noninvasive ventilation in patients with acute respiratory failure.
secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of skin pressure ulcers in patients treated with noninvasive ventilation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Incidence of skin pressure ulcers. Patients will be followed during duration of high dependency unit stay for an average length of stay of 7 days.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
